title: Why was Mohammed (PBUH), the most beloved prophet of Allah (SWT)? - Quora

response.answer_text: Prophet Muhammad(PBUH) was the greatest of all mankind; his mercy covered all, Muslims, non-Muslims, trees, animals, humans, non-humans.When he(PBUH) sent an army to fight the oppressors and aggressors, he ordered his companions, the leaders of the army not to kill an old man or a child or a woman and not to cut a tree or destroy a building, not to slaughter animals except for food.He(PBUH) also ordered them not to disturb the monks worshiping in their churches or Rabbis in their synagogues and to leave them alone in their hermitages as long as they don't fight them.Some Ayats of Quran that shows love of ALLAH for Prophet Muhammad (PBUH):1. If you want to gain the love of Allah, follow him (3:31)2. Allah addresses him with love and affection (20:1) (36:1) (73:1) (74:1)3. Allah says: Realize that My Prophetic Messenger himself is with you (49:7)4. Allah describes him with His Own Attributes of Rauf (Most Kind) and Rahim (Merciful) (9:128)5. Allah Himself praises him (33:45-47)6. Possessor of Allah’s Grace (4:113)7. He is a special favour of Allah (Sub’hanahu wa Ta’ala) (3:164)8. Allah does not punish people if he is in their midst (8:33)9. Allegiance to him is allegiance to Allah (48:10) Our Prophet(PBUH), was the blessed one, He could have lived his life at his will, without any struggle, effort, or work yet he chose not to, yet chose to go through all the trouble for us! For his(PBUH) people, he (PBUH) used to stay awake all night, crying, praying. just for us, just for the sake that on day of judgment his ummat shall be forgiven, Whenever he asked something from ALLAH, he(PBUH) used to ask of mercy for his people, for those who were there at that time and for those like us.Surely, this was one of countless things that HE(PBUH) was the most beloved of ALLAH.
